title: Illaoi and her Balance in the current game meta.
body:
So basically, i decided to buy Illaoi since i hit 6.3k IP and it was a choice between her and Aatrox, and having just played her i feel like she is very overwhelming in the current meta.

Game 1: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/117364136/200474676?tab=overview
Game 2: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/117372700/200474676?tab=stats

So basically Illaoi at this point in time feels like an AD Heimerdinger, i say this, because it becomes very overwhelming very quickly, as unlike heimer Illaoi can have as many tentacles as she can place (especially due to her ult) and she basically becomes impossible to deal with, to the point that in both these games, i was opening inhibs at the 16 minute mark and the 22 minute mark, solo and with massive ease.

Unless she backs, or decides to hand them to you, each of her tentacle spawns is very hard to kill, as you either have to trade some health for that tentacle to go down, or all in the Illaoi and kill her, and multiple times, when people were killing my tentacles i just made them respawn in the exact same place (because you have a surprisingly high control over tentacle placements, they place to the closest wall to you, assuming no other tentacle is in range)

And she comes to the point, where you are forced to send several people to fight her, which just increases her power, not to mention, in the second game when this happened, i was blowing 3+ ults and making it so everyone that came top had to back.

Given the current meta and the complete and utter lack of tanks especially in top lane, i feel like her strength is too high, sure there are people who drag her win rate down, as they just play her cause she is OP, but she is an oppressive top laner that just brutalizes people.

Not to mention at least twice when i was ganked in game 1, both Wukong and Yi were deleted (with just a phage and warhammer was the first time) to the point that no one either team understood how they died so fast.

This is just me trying to pull some attention to Illaoi, as having just picked her up, she feels way too oppressive, and i don't recall ever having a nice time when laning against her.

replies.body:
The tentacles are insanely powerful I often have trouble trying to juggle cs+harrass and ultimately end up turret sitting constantly dodging and killing them ,only to have them pop up seconds later 

Frustrationn lvl - rage inducing.

Illaoi is not unbalanced. I have played games verse her and with her on my team (I have picked her up, but have sadly not played her yet). I'm not trying to be a douche canoe, but are you in bronze? Lower ELO players will have no idea how to verse her, and that may be why you're stomping so hard.

She heals when she hits champs. Combined with anything like Spirit Visage, whenever she is engaged by multiple enemies, she can heal for a tonne of hp. Lower ELO players think "More gankers = more profit". But with Illaoi, the reverse is true. She's actually far easier to deal with 1v1. You simply have to dodge the tentacles, kill the odd one when it pops up, and treat her like any other bruiser top laner.

I have never had a problem versing her. Even with squishee champs, you simply have to dodge, kill and repeat. I've never had an Illaoi on my team get 'fed', except on ARAM where those cramped quarters means Illaoi is all but bound to hit every single tentacle.

If anything, I would say she is mostly UNDERpowered. Her reliance on tentacles means she does well in top and jungle, but once if moves out of those realms, for example with ganks or team pushing other lanes, she is incredibly exposed. She also is a walking notification of her movements; if she's nearby, you can see her tentacles pop up or spawn. This is especially detrimental when trying to silently gank. Likewise, when she moves out of lane, or backs, you see her tentacles retract, meaning you can push lane or pursue other objectives.

As soon as the enemy figure out how to play against her, and shut her down in team fights so she can't blast in halfway through and hentai everyone to death, then there aren't really a lot of ways Illaoi can 'outplay' her opponents. She basically gets close, smashes with tentacles. That's it. No fancy moves like Zed, or Lee, or Yas. She's really quite basic and it requires a basic team to do poorly verse her.

Jesus, someone is touchy! I even said I didn't mean it as an insult. If you read my comment, I wasn't insinuating that you were a Bronze player, but that you may be versing Bronze players who don't understand how to alter their gameplay when versing certain champions. I don't really need to defend my 'rank' to you, but I will say that I got to Silver, but realised I wasn't really that good (plus the number of feeders I was running into in ranked was crazy!), so have been practicing in norms ever since, and am now probably playing at a Gold level. Just because your mechanical play isn't as good as your knowledge of the game, doesn't mean your opinion counts any less, and for a "Gold" player, you are quite up yourself if I do say so myself!

That said, I stand by my original comment. I have never really had issue versing Illaoi. If you can dodge, you can hold lane. Maybe not win lane, but that of course is because Illaoi is a lane opponent. When she ventures out, away from her nest of tentacles, she becomes far weaker. That's her "thing". You deal with her the same way you deal with Nasus's laning.
